column4: I've just installed 8.10 on a macbook (2,1) and the keyboard is all messed up. What used to be keys 108 and 116 are now something else - 108 is the down arrow, not sure about 116. I now have no down arrow button. However, I know that X is detecting it correctly since in the gdm login screen, the arrow works fine... So it's something in my user profile
Any ideas on what it is in my user profile that's messing things up?
#ubuntu+1 ?
do you have a ~.xmodmap ? or .xkeymap?
after d/ling xmodmap, logout & back in
What do you mean downloading xmodmap?
deleting
It's not a separate package now, it's installed with xserver-utils, which I'm not sure that I can delete...
I mean in your home directory - does ls  ~/.x* show anything?
but even if I could delete it, I don't want to since I want to eventually get the right click mapped to the right apple key like it was before...
oh, you mean delete the .xmodmap file? ok, will do
don't delete - just rename
Do I need to restart X, or can I just type in a command to update the settings?
restart X
Same thing as before
dunno - try preferences -> keyboard layout
I've tried apple, apple laptop, apple laptop international, macbook/macbook pro and  all sorts of stuff, they all have the same results
I'm going to try the other layouts again, brb
No effect :( The apple laptop layouts are all the same
dunno, maybe try google
tried, with no success... This was my last-ditch attempt...
I don't believe it's only you with this problem
